Is it a raccoon? Is it a dog? No, it's a raccoon dog!

January 27, 2015

Raccoon dogs have been adorably taking the internet by storm. Aside from cuteness, what else makes this animal so interesting?

  • Raccoon dogs, also known as "Tanuki," are actually neither dogs nor raccoons! They are members of the canid family, which includes dogs, wolves, and foxes.
  • They are the only member of the canid family that hibernates in winter!
  • Tanuki are native to East Asia. In Japanese folklore, they are shape-shifters associated with magic and luck!
  • The Super Mario item "tanooki suit" is based off the raccoon dog and grants Mario/Luigi cool powers!

Sadly, life is not all fun and games for the raccoon dog. They are often inhumanely bred and killed for their pelts, which are sold as "faux fur."
